intro: Psychotria usambarensis, commonly known as the Usambara Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the montane forests of East Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
